name: hydrography
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the scientific study of the typical features of oceans, lakes, and rivers, and the making of maps to represent them: The father of modern hydrography, Captain Cook, began his surveys around Quebec. This department is responsible for fisheries management, oceanography, and hydrography.
the typical features of the oceans, lakes, and rivers in a particular region: The region's natural hydrography has already been highly modified by the building work. The government is approving the destruction of sites which are highly valuable, and representative of our hydrography.
More examplesFewer examplesHis research findings were sophisticated, considering what was known about hydrography at the time.The project aims to gather and collate meteorology and hydrography data.Learning hydrography and map making were two vital steps in advancing her career.
